comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: That looks very solid for a temporary structure.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: and yet it has gone ... The picture was taken in Nowy Sącz (German: Neu Sandez or formerly Neu Sandec). Now in southern Poland, the town was part of the Habsburg Empire (Galicia) until November 1918. "At the beginning of World War I, Nowy Sącz was occupied by the Russian Army. The Russians were driven back by the Central powers in December 1914" en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nowy_S%C4%85cz The building visible in the picture has outlived the wars and is shown here: www.panoramio.com/photo/44729291 and here:

comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: Bridges change but the best place to cross the river doesn't move.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: B-59: Thank you for the additional details about Nowy Sącz and for providing the photo of what the site looks like today. We will add more information when we update. I am glad the beautiful building in the background survived.
